Try/except - How to use it as Dsigned

There appears to be a misunderstanding of what the try/except construct is all about and how it was designed to be used.Dr. Chuck explains how to use try/except in lecture video Worked Example 3.2. try/except should be used to handlewhat\'s called an exception. An exception is an error detected during execution of a program although the program might be syntactically correct. Most exceptions will cause the program to come to an unintended stop and display a Traceback error message such as ValueError, ZeroDivisionError, TypeError, etc. If you write a program where you prompt the user to enter a number and the user enters a string where you would expect a number.
